channel.title: 350 Third
channel.description: 350 Third is a bi-weekly talk show discussing the impact of the Internet on business. Hosted by Scott Barstow and Anders Brownworth.

channel.itunes:author: Scott Barstow, Anders Brownworth

item.title: Episode #73 - Self Driving Cars
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: What if you had the chance to redefine something as fundamental as transportation? Scott and Anders discuss the self driving car and what it could mean to society.
item.description: What if you had the chance to redefine something as fundamental as transportation? Scott and Anders discuss the self driving car and what it could mean to society.

item.itunes:keywords: Self Driving Car, Google, Scott Barstow, Anders Brownworth, podcast, talkshow, talk show

item.title: Episode #72 - Android to iPhone
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Scott moves from the iPhone to Android and Anders argues Google isn't eavesdropping even though your phone is always listening!

item.title: Episode #71 - Groundfloor.us
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Brian Dally joins us for a discussion of his Groundfloor.us, the real estate microlending marketplace. We discuss how the Internet is "blowing up" investment strategies in the real estate industry.

item.title: Episode #70 - Ephemeral Computing
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Peer to peer package delivery via a smartphone app? Scott and Anders discuss a reputation based package delivery system and theorize about the coming world where micro scaling gives rise to ephemeral computing.
item.description: Peer to peer package delivery via a smartphone app? Scott and Anders discuss a reputation based package delivery system and theorize about the coming world where micro scaling gives rise to ephemeral computing.

item.itunes:keywords: P2P Package Delivery, Peer to Peer, Packages, Ephemeral Computing, Scott Barstow, Anders Brownworth, podcast, talkshow, talk show
item.author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth

item.title: Episode #69 - Prime Laundering
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Amazon Prime prices have increased - has a master plan been enacted, or is this just the economic reality of inflation? Join Scott and Anders for a discussion about it and a dive into Money Laundering!

item.title: Episode #68 - News and Users
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: An emerging high production value news source, Vice News, covers the situation in the Ukraine demonstrating a hint at journalism's future and the biggest bid ever for users with Facebook's acquisition of WhatsApp demonstrating that people will pay for a service.

item.title: Episode #62 - Rocket Science
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Horace Dediu joins us for a discussion about the history of the space industry and its more recent commercial direction. We touch on the history of governmental and private investments in space as well as possible asymmetric strategies for the future including a railgun and the ever elusive space elevator. Does the commercial exploitation of space fit within a timescale business is able to accept?
item.description: Horace Dediu joins us for a discussion about the history of the space industry and its more recent commercial direction. We touch on the history of governmental and private investments in space as well as possible asymmetric strategies for the future including a railgun and the ever elusive space elevator. Does the commercial exploitation of space fit within a timescale business is able to accept?
item.itunes:summary: Horace Dediu joins us for a discussion about the history of the space industry and its more recent commercial direction. We touch on the history of governmental and private investments in space as well as possible asymmetric strategies for the future including a railgun and the ever elusive space elevator. Does the commercial exploitation of space fit within a timescale business is able to accept?
item.content:encoded: Horace Dediu joins us for a discussion about the history of the space industry and its more recent commercial direction. We touch on the history of governmental and private investments in space as well as possible asymmetric strategies for the future including a railgun and the ever elusive space elevator. Does the commercial exploitation of space fit within a timescale business is able to accept?
item.itunes:keywords: Space, Commercial Space Exploration, Rockets, Launch Vehicles, Exploration, Horace Dediu, Scott Barstow, Anders Brownworth, podcast, talkshow, talk show
item.author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth

item.title: Episode #60 - 3D Printing Revolution
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: What would life be like if 3D printing were a commonplace as bubblejet and laser printers are today? Scott and Anders discuss how your world might change in the next 5 to 10 years.

item.title: Episode #59 - Stan Phelps - The Impact Of the Internet on Marketing
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Stan Phelps, founder of 9 Inch Marketing, author of What's Your Green Goldfish and What's Your Purple Goldfish joins us on the show to talk about how the Internet is changing marketing, how TV marketing will evolve and argue with Anders about Amazon.

item.title: Episode #58 - HotSpot 2.0
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Scott and Anders discuss 802.11u, which is also known as HotSpot 2.0, Passpoint or Interworking. It allows a WiFi device to automatically associate with access points through shared credentials rather than having to have separate accounts for each network.
item.description: Scott and Anders discuss 802.11u, which is also known as HotSpot 2.0, Passpoint or Interworking. It allows a WiFi device to automatically associate with access points through shared credentials rather than having to have separate accounts for each network.

item.itunes:keywords: Hotspot 2.0, HS 2.0, 802.11u, interworking, passpoint, WiFi, republic wireless, Scott Barstow, Anders Brownworth, podcast, talkshow, talk show
item.author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth

item.title: Episode #57 - The Peer Network
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Scott and Anders discuss the rising tide of peer networks. From Bitcoin to WebRTC, the Internet is slowly moving back to it's roots. In this episode we explore how email, domains and other every-day applications will change over the coming years

item.itunes:keywords: P2P, Peer, Bitcoin, WebRTC, Bittorrent, Napster, Skype, Privacy, Crypto, NameCoin, Scott Barstow, Anders Brownworth, podcast, talkshow, talk show
item.author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth

item.title: Episode #56 - Farshad Nayeri - Perspective
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Continuing their discussion of the post-PC ecosystem, Scott and Anders interview Farshad Nayeri, founder of Pixxa, the company that develops the Perspective iPad app. Perspective addresses both content creation and content consumption making it truely a post-PC ecosystem contender.

item.title: Episode #55 - The Post PC Ecosystem
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: If there is a post PC era, there have to be apps for every job that don't require or presume a PC. What does that app ecosystem look like? Scott and Anders discuss the Post PC Ecosystem.

item.title: Episode #53 - Node.js
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Node.js package growth has been going at a staggering clip lately. Scott and Anders discuss Node.js entering an inflection point of sorts and trade war stories of Node.js in production.

item.title: Episode #52 - Evolution
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, Anders and Scott study the computer fossils they have lying around their houses. From 300 baud modems to gender benders to print servers to token ring networks, they talk about the evolution of technology in the last 15 or so years.

item.title: Episode #43 - Does Technology Deliver on the Promise?
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: For all the time spent creating it and all the money spent on it, does technology actually make our collective lives better? Scott and Anders discuss delivering on the promise using the examples of the iPhone, Salesforce.com and Gmail keyboard shortcuts.

item.title: Episode #42 - What to do with Great Talent
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: We all know who they are - those standout technology people that seem to effortlessly do the work of 10. Scott and Anders discuss what to do with great talent.

item.title: Episode #8 - SMS, Twitter in iOS, Keeping Current and Detrich Bonhoeffer
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: SMS, Twitter in iOS, Keeping Current and Detrich Bonhoeffer
item.description: The rise of texting amidst the decline of SMS, Twitter's big win and how do old programmers keep up? Scott and Anders talk technology and Detrich Bonhoeffer.

item.title: Episode #7 - Software Patents, Cell Radiation and Free Money for Teenagers
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Software Patents, Cell Radiation and Free Money for Teenagers
item.description: Are software patents on balance a good or a bad thing? Are cellphones this generation's cigerette? And would you give a pile of money to a teenager to start businesses in lieu of going to college? Scott and Anders talk about these things and "Dumb and Dumber" in this week's episode.
item.itunes:summary: Are software patents on balance a good or a bad thing? Are cellphones this generation's cigerette? item.title: Episode #6 - NFC, Drones and The Hunt for Red October
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: NFC, Drones and The Hunt for Red October
item.description: Scott and Anders talk Google Wallet, Near Field Communication, GetAround.com and the Mac Defender "virus" in this week's rewind. Android marketshare seems to have leveled off according to a recent Nielsen blog post and the world of drones show unbelievable commercial promise. And on amnesia lane, Scott and Anders take on the 1990 movie "The Hunt for Red October".

item.title: Episode #5 - Car OS, Bitcoin and the Meaning of U2
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Car OS, Bitcoin and the Meaning of U2
item.description: What if your car told you everything? In this episode, Anders and Scott talk about what the ideal car operating system might have. From the news, they discuss Bitcoin and Linked In, and in this week's trip down Amnesia Lane they discuss the music of U2.

item.title: Episode #4 - Cars, Computers and Wall Street
item.itunes:author: Scott Barstow & Anders Brownworth
item.itunes:subtitle: Cars, Computers and Wall Street
item.description: Would you rent your car to a complete stranger? RelayRides.com and GetAround.com are betting you will. Find out what kind of computer hardware Scott and Anders use and of course talk about the movie Wall Street.
